text.text:
A serene and historically significant Catholic church nestled on a quiet hilltop near Bukit Purmei. Its striking Romanesque architecture, complete with elegant arches, high ceilings, and a beautiful white façade, sets it apart as one of the more unique church buildings in the city.

Inside, the atmosphere is calm and reverent, with soft natural lighting adding to the spiritual ambiance. The church provides a peaceful setting for prayer, reflection, or attending mass. The community is warm and welcoming.

As one of the few churches in Singapore built in this architectural style, it offers both spiritual nourishment and visual beauty, making it a memorable place to visit for locals and visitors alike. Whether you're attending a service or exploring its history, the Church of St. Teresa offers a deeply meaningful experience.

text.text: I had yet another beautiful experience at this Church. Needless to say Christ is alive here!

originalText.text: I had yet another beautiful experience at this Church. Needless to say Christ is alive here!

text.text:
A very beautiful Catholic church.
Large well-maintained grounds, columbarium.
St. Theresa's Church is one of the churches in the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Singapore. Built in 1929, it has been a national monument since 2009.
Today, I did not venture inside the church during the farewell to the deceased.
But you can check out all the information on the website and decide when to visit here. The website has all the detailed information on masses and free admission to the temple.

text.text:
Very beautiful parish, located a few bus stops away from Outram Park MRT. They did the Angelus and Salve Regina in Latin on an ordinary weekday mass.

The homily was very insightful and easy to listen to without drifting off

text.text: Good and old church that was renovated. One of its kind in SG. Have some stained glass. Aircon is good. Acoustic is good. The current priest was a chancellor so his preaching is true to the word. Hospitality team is also great.
